lead_paragraph: Deaths from childhood cancer fell 20 percent in the United States from 1999 to 2014. Clinical trials have led to small changes in practice, one expert said.

headline.main: Cancer in Retreat on One Front: Fewer Children Are Dying

snippet: Deaths from childhood cancer fell 20 percent in the United States from 1999 to 2014. Clinical trials have led to small changes in practice, one expert said....
abstract: National Center for Health Statistics report shows childhood deaths from cancer fell by 20 percent between 1999 and 2014; experts say reduction is due to clinical trials that led to small changes in medical practices.
